scheduler.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.task.Task
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScheduledTask, UnscheduledTask

    public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an appointment either still needs to be scheduled or is already scheduled.

    • Field Detail

      • userDefinedID

        private java.lang.String userDefinedID
        We will ask the user if they would like to give this task a specific name or identifier. If they do, then that information gets stored here. Once this task has been scheduled we can then say: "Task with ID "" has been scheduled" so the user knows which tasks have been scheduled after the taskQueue in TaskManager has been updated.

      • patient

        protected PatientFile patient

        public static java.util.LinkedList<Schedulable> cloneCollection(java.util.Collection<Schedulable> myResource)
        This method can be used to clone collections of Schedulables so they are safe to return.
        Parameters:
        myResource - The collection of Schedulables one would like to clone.
        Returns:
        A cloned collection of myResource

      • canHaveAsResources

        public static boolean canHaveAsResources(java.util.Collection<Schedulable> s)
        Returns:
        False if the given collection is not a valid resource-source.

      • isValidDuration

        public static boolean isValidDuration(long d)
        Returns:
